name: Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay

reviews.text: This no-frills Holiday Inn Express has an excellent location to the major Times Square shopping mall and MTR Causeway Bay station (50 metres). No grand entrance and perhaps hard to get a taxi in that location but the hotel has efficient and polite staff who check you in fast and also aware of most traveler's needs, such as late-check out requests, free set breakfast meal vouchers and concierge support.
reviews.title: Great Location - no-frills and efficient hotel

reviews.text: For a Hong Kong hotel, the room is quite spacious with space for reasonably long desk and sofa. Did I forget to say - free hi-speed broadband internet? YES....no hourly or daily charge like some creamy hotels. Simple CRT TV but all the channels are there and a useful kettle with complimentary tea bags and instant coffee. I love it when the fridge is empty for your own food shopping and who drinks from the mini-bar anyway? Good cupboard space with proper hangers that you don't fiddle with.
reviews.title: Good value, good central location but traffice noise

reviews.text: The only minor complaint is that being in Hong Kong, you will always hear the humming of the traffic and street for a city that never sleeps. Otherwise, the bed is clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great value hotel, free internet and breakfast, super efficient and excellent location

reviews.text: To be honest - I prefer staying on the Kowloon side in Whampoa - Harbour Grand Hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, Good value for money!

reviews.text: But during the course of the year there are plenty of fairs and other reason while the hotel prices are going through the roof. In this case - hands down - this is the best choice you can make. The hotel is no frills or fancy settings but for the money you pay it is a great value.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Close to Shops, No Frills Rooms, Nice Breakfast

reviews.text: Here for 3 days and had no moajor problems to complain about.
reviews.title: Good location, too small for a family room

reviews.text: Room and bathroom was clean and comfortable, however for 3 people was small as the 3rd person had a sofa bed which left no room to move around.
reviews.title: Great location, nice bfast & service. Terrible internet speed !

reviews.text: The only problem I can recall with the bathroom was that the toilet was very slow in flushing and the pipes were not big enough.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay in GREAT Location

reviews.text: Breakfast was very nice each morning, a little slow if arriving when a lot were already down or at the end of service as staff were trying to set up for lunch. OK choice of food but very standard.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.text: If I went back to Hong Kong I would possibly stay here again if the price was right as location was good with tube and shopping centre very close by.
reviews.title: Good Location. All basic needs met.

reviews.text: The hotel is strategically located in Causeway Bay area, thus in walking distance you can find many shops. The nearest department store is Times Square. It's also 5-mins walking distance from Time Square MTR station. Taxis are easily found near hotel. Finding restaurants is also quite easy within the area.Many shops open until 1 a.m. There is also a 24-hour supermarket (Wellcome).
reviews.title: Nicely located, average service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is very clean and looks new. Some rooms got flat-screen TV (not all). Free wi fi is available. However the service is just average. The front-line people were not really friendly and almost never smile. Breakfast were not great, but okay....(the croissant was nice, but porridge and noodle were tastless).
reviews.title: Good enough. Perfect location.

reviews.text: My friends and I were looking for hotel with good location, and we got it. Just don't expect to get great service here.
reviews.title: Stay here.

reviews.text: For our last trip, we wanted to just stay within Causeway Bay to shop and eat. The location was perfect because it was at the heart of Causeway Bay, just behind Times Square. The lobby didn't look like a regular hotel lobby, but I didn't mind because hey, it's supposed to be a budget hotel. There was an internet station, where we were able to print out our boarding pass for our trip home, for a very minimal fee.
reviews.title: Decent budget choice in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean. It was smaller than what we were used to but we didn't mind because we could still move around. The bathroom was clean and big enough.
reviews.title: Good location. Clean. Will stay here again.
Small rooms but good value for HK with great location
reviews.text: Express by Holiday Inn Causeway Bay has an excellent location right across the street from Times Square. Hint: if you are eating at any of the restaurants in TS, there is an express lift to 9F accessible by a small door to the left of the Lane Crawford door across from the hotel. Rooms are small, but they do take reservations for 4 (2 adults and 2 children) without additional charge. Our room had a sofa bed that was large enough for our 8 and 11 year olds. There is no dresser storage in the room, so you literally live our of your suitcase. With 2 single beds and the fold out sofa, there was little floor space leftover. There is free wired internet in the rooms and wireless in the lobby. There is no 110V power anywhere in the room; I had to buy a step down transformer for our kids Nintendo DS. Bathrooms are small with shower only and dispensers for all around soap/shampoo. Breakfast is included, and you have your choice of rice congee, scrambled eggs, corn flakes, fried noodles, hamburger, or instant noodles along with juice and coffee or tea. Portions are very large. All in all, this is a good value and great location for HK. Hotel was convenient to Causeway Bay MTR station. Staff was friendly and even recommended some cheaper drop off Laundromats a few blocks a way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three days. The hotel was exactly what was described and to the standard expected at this type of hotel.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: There was no baggage porter but plenty of carts were available.
reviews.title: Really value for money!

reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast was provided in a dining establishment not owned by the company, who provided vouchers giving a choice of 6 plated dishes. Three of which would suit more western tastes.
reviews.title: Great value in a convenient location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the staff friendly and helpful, and a couple of e-mail enquiries we made before travelling were answered satisfactorily by return.
reviews.title: Close to the action!

reviews.text: I stayed last March 2012 with my friend. First time to stay in Causeway Bay area. The rooms not to big. But, then again, you are in Hong Kong. The location is busy. The hotel itself is behind Times Square. From the mrt, its a bit of a walk so its best if you're luggage has wheels. I've discovered HK MTR has normally several exits and the underground is quite vasts. The bed was comfy and the bathroom clean. The breakfast was included in the price. A simple ala carte meal.
reviews.title: Right on Times Square!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Holiday Inn Causeway bay for 9 nights end of Jan / beginning of Feb and found it to be excellent. I had read the reviews about hotel so when we arrived we were not expecting a lot,just somewhere to sleep really but were amazed how clean our room was, also how roomy it was,way larger than we expected. Every morning we went down for our free breakfast which was a choice of 5 different dishes,all served with fresh juice,fruit and as much coffee as we wanted. We never had to wait anymore than a few minutes to place our order, even when the place was busy.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.text: The location is definitely a plus,a great area for shopping etc and the train station is a 5 minute walk. The excellent public transport system would put other countries to shame.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: All in all,an excellent place to stay,helpful,friendly & considering location,extremely well priced
reviews.title: Couldn't agree more with the four-point rating by tripadvisor

reviews.text: My husband and I often stay at this hotel as we were able to book on the cheap, via a "friends and family discount" (we have friends who work for the Intercontinental group of hotels). It's ideally located right across Times Square. Rooms are small but always clean, they serve complimentary breakfast (just average but still appreciated), and there is a computer room by the lobby with individual computer workstations stocked with paper, pens and other office supplies. All in all a really good value-for-money hotel in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Excellent location and value

reviews.text: Situated behind Times Square makes in really convenient to get to from the airport and around HK. Airport Express is easily the best way to Hong Kong Island then MTR to Causeway Bay and the hotel is 2 mins. Bit of a building site around the hotel but should be improving quite quickly.
reviews.title: Good location, good size room for HK

reviews.text: Check-in - easy and quick and after a long day travelling this is just what you want
reviews.title: good place to transit

reviews.text: Room - good size with large bed and crisp linen, pillows are excellent. Sofa (sofa-bed) was a bit rickety and wouldn't have wanted to sleep on it but did give somewhere to sit. Desk and chair with kettle & 2 bottles of water but the water from the tap is fine once boiled, Take some coffee sticks if you like your coffee as although there are two sachets with kettle the two together dont make one mug. One thing that did surprise me was the old CRT television in the room with quite a small screen, I would expect a larger flat screen from HK where techno is king! Plenty of English channels (including the old standby BBC World) and some movie channels.
reviews.title: Make a comparison, nothing can change my mind!

reviews.text: Bathroom - quite small but some toiletries, shower and loo. Plenty of towels.
reviews.title: Excellent value for a low-cost stay

reviews.text: Facilities - none really, there are a couple of restaurants in the hotel but didn't really appeal.
reviews.title: very good, reasonably priced hotel close to Hong Kong Stadium

reviews.text: We stayed here for five nights in December for my daughter's 8th birthday surprise, my 40th birthday and my mums 65th. This is a brilliant hotel in a fantastic location right next to Times Square. The MTR station is just a short 10 minute stroll. The staff were extremely helpful and responsive to any request. The room was an excellent size, plenty of room for two adults and two children aged 8 and 6 who slept like little logs each night. Very comfortable beds, freshly changed bed linen and towels daily and free bottled water. A free safe and fridge in your room also. The free breakfast was a nice touch and meant that we were able to start each day with a freshly baked crossaint and fried egg. Would definitly stay here on our next trip!!
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel in a brilliant location with excellent staff and facilities

reviews.text: This hotel was one of the few in Hong Kong that was willing to accommodate 2 children and 2 adults in one room. I chose it because of its proximity to Times Square and the MTR station. And I am so glad I did! The room, although very basic, was spacious, with 2 beds plus a sofa bed. It was also near Ocean Park which was our destination. I would gladly choose this hotel again next time we're in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: I reviewed this hotel in 2006, and am happy to say my return visit exceeded my expectations. All the rooms now have a mini-fridge, and while the price has risen somewhat over the past 4 years, the rooms are still among the largest in Hong Kong for this class. The bed was comfortable and my room on a high floor was quiet. Do not expect frills or even a bell boy. Just clean comfortable accommodations at a reasonable price in a great location next to Times Square. The free in-room internet makes this an even better deal. If you have stayed at other Holiday Inn Express locations, you will have no surprises here. The maid service did not occur until after 5PM each day which was unusual.
reviews.title: Still One of the Best Hotel Values in Hong Kong

reviews.text: Right next to Time Square which is very popular shopping place. 100 meters to the subway network which makes the travel very easy. Room is quite big comparing with some other holidays in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Very good hotel with great location

reviews.text: I stayed here with my daughter for 2 nights on our way to Sydney. The hotel is perfectly good for a short stay as it is opposite Times Square - huge shopping mall with restaurants at the top. (Get separate lifts to access restaurants). Reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms were typical Holiday Inn Express - clean, functional, with a sofabed. The best thing was the free internet access in a room next to reception. We also got complimentary bottles of water each day (why can't all hotels offer it????). The beds were comfy and a choice of pillows. Free tea and coffee in rooms too.
reviews.title: Good value, good location ......awful breakfast

reviews.text: Location was fantastic...it couldn't be beat for the money. Hotel is literally across the street from the Times Square shopping area. Upstairs in the mall, there is a food forum and fine restaurants...all very delish. The Causeway bay areas has shops and eateries will stay open past midnight. Great for overseas travelers still jet-lagged and looking for things to do. We were out and about the majority of the time, so the room was only used for sleep and shower. Location was very important for us.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good value

reviews.text: Hotel is simple, no frills.The rooms reminded me of college dorm rooms. Small by western standards, but big enough for 2 adults and 1 young child, and 3 huge suitcases. It could be cleaner, but overall not bad. Extras like bottled waters, toothbrush/paste, and room slippers were replenished daily. We saved the extra slippers to bring home.
reviews.title: Convenient location, clean, comfortable and great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not try the concierge or used the hotel staff much...we knew what we wanted to do, where to go, and what to see. So no comments on the hotel staff. A business center was available with free internet and computers ( we did not use.) No wi-fi in rooms, but free broadband is available and worked fine when we used it. The hotel also provides complimentary use of electrical converter...you can ask downstairs for extras.
reviews.title: Good location, smallish room but not too bad.

reviews.text: The set breakfasts were not as bad as per some of the reviews. For Westerners, it may seem daunting, but pick through what you like (fruit, yogurt) to hold you through the morning...then chow on the good stuff for lunch and dinner. Choice of set breakfasts included:
reviews.title: Nice Location Terrible Breakafast ,

reviews.text: A) Congee with cuttlefish balls, man tou (chinese steam bun)
reviews.title: Very clean, good service, great location

aka: Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay Hotel Hong Kong
description: Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay Hong Kong is located in the center of bustling Causeway Bay. Enjoying its great location, the hotel stands alongside popular Times Square, and is just a short distance away from Golden Bauhinia Square, Victoria Peak, Lan Kwai Fong and many more. Causeway Bay and neighboring Wan Chai are renowned city districts that are often thought of as the Shinjuku of Hong Kong, in reference to Tokyo s dazzling Shinjuko commercial center. A 24-hour convenience shop and the Causeway Bay metro station are handily located just outside the hotel entrance. What s more, famous Happy Valley Turf Club and Hong Kong Stadium are an easy a five-minute stroll away, while Stanley Town and Repulse Bay are 10 minutes walk and Ocean Park, 15 minutes. Exciting Hong Kong Disney Land is 35 minutes drive from the hotel and Hong Kong International Airport is conveniently only 45 minutes away. At Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay Hong Kong, our ideal location puts all of Hong Kong s excitement at your fingertips. We offer 282 spacious rooms, each inclusive of comfortable bedding, full bathroom facilities, high-speed internet and access to our free breakfast. Whether taking care of business or enjoying a leisure vacation, Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay Hong Kong meets all your needs.
